excerpts.text: Perplexity has been surprisingly good for the use-case of when I want to look something technical up and also want the citations and the links because I donâ€™t trust LLMs to just generate the answer for me.

text:
Announcing a major update to Perplexity Ask: the worldâ€™s first conversational search engine! Now, you can read answers with up-to-date sources and ask follow-up questions to dig deeper. In other words, you can chat with your search engine!

Try it out at http://perplexity.ai
author: Perplexity AI

title: How bad are search results? Let's compare Google, Bing, Marginalia, Kagi, Mwmbl, and ChatGPT
author: Dan Luu

excerpts.text: I love everything about Marginalia, which is a search engine with its own index, run by a single dude, initially on a server in his apartment.

Iâ€™ve been hearing more and more about Kagi and finally decided to try it out in January. The results were so good that I immediately bought a subscription and switched my default search engine in my web and mobile browser to Kagi.

text: The next iteration of Perplexity has arrived: Copilot, your interactive AI search companion. ðŸš€ðŸ¤– Perplexity Copilot guides your search experience with interactive inputs, leading you to a rich, personalized answer, powered by GPT-4. Try it for free at http://perplexity.ai

Something I'm super-excited about: Deep Search (aka "Search Harder"). You know how, when researching something complicated, you try several queries, read many documents? We make GPT-4 do it for you. Already flighting:

Ahrefs is getting closer to publicly promoting the Web Search Engine we are working on. In case you missed the previous announcement â€“ the point of our search engine is to share ad revenue with content creators 90/10. With 90% going to creators.

ðŸš€ Exciting news! I'm thrilled to announce the official launch of my open-source alternative to PerplexityAI! Your feedback has been invaluable in shaping the app.

#OpenSourceAI #SearchAI
author: Bishal Saha

text:
Last night we hacked together a clone of @perplexity_ai as a fun experiment. We used @ExaAILabs for web searches, @togethercompute to serve Llama 3, and of course used @joinpongo for semantic filtering.

We're calling it "Simplicity" the lightweight open-source Perplexity. Simplicity is far from the incredible and complete product that is Perplexity but it's cool to see what you can hack together just using off the shelf APIs.

Try it out and view the source code below.
author: Caleb John

excerpts.text: One promising attempt at breadth-first research is Globe Explorer. I think of it as a self-assembling Wikipedia page. It gives you a map of all possible ideas related to your query, organized into a hierarchy that makes it easy to go deep or wide. The results feel exhaustive.
